conclusion: The liquids will flow out from A, B, and C and need to be tracked to determine which container (D, E, or F) they flow into after passing through baffles.
Containers A, B, and C are positioned at the top of the setup, and containers D, E, and F are positioned at the bottom.
The setup contains various baffles: black, purple, yellow, and cyan, which redirect the flow of liquids.
Liquid from A flows downward and encounters a black baffle that redirects the flow to the left.
Liquid from A continues downward and passes through a yellow baffle that does not change its path.
Liquid from A reaches container D.
Liquid from B flows downward and encounters a purple baffle that redirects the flow to the right.
Liquid from B continues downward and passes through a cyan baffle that redirects it further to the left.
Liquid from B reaches container E.
Liquid from C flows downward and encounters a purple baffle that redirects the flow downward.
Liquid from C continues downward and passes through a cyan baffle that redirects it to the left.
Liquid from C reaches container F.
Based on the paths analyzed, liquid from A flows into container D, liquid from B flows into container E, and liquid from C flows into container F.
Container D collects the liquid from A, container E collects the liquid from B, and container F collects the liquid from C.
